sentences: Meil on veel teisi planeedeid uurida.
context: In Estonian, 'teist' is the partitive case form of 'teine', which means 'other', 'another', or 'second'. It's used to indicate an indefinite quantity of something other than what has been mentioned before. In English translations, it often corresponds to 'some other', 'some another', or simply 'other' depending on context.
